= [[Climate of India|Climate]] | blank1_info_sec2 = [[Climatic regions of India|Hot,cold and normal]] {{small|([[Köppen climate classification|Köppen]])}} | website = | footnotes = }} '''Napasar''' is a town located in the [[Bikaner district]] in the [[India]]n state of [[Rajasthan]]. It is also known as one of most holy place of Bikaner. <ref>[http://iay.nic.in/netiay/benf_lvl2.aspx?scheme=2&page=p&fin_year=2012-2013&state_name=RAJASTHAN&state_code=27&district_name=BIKANER&block_name=%E0%A4%AC%E0%A5%80%E0%A4%95%E0%A4%BE%E0%A4%A8%E0%A5%87%E0%A4%B0&panchayat_code=2703001050&panchayat_name=%E0%A4%A8%E0%A4%BE%E0%A4%AA%E0%A4%BE%E0%A4%B8%E0%A4%B0&shortname=RJ Rural Housing Report for Financial year 2012–2013]</ref>
Napasar was established as a "co-city" by the contemporary King of the Bikaner state: Maharaja Bikaji and Napaji Sankhala.{{clarify|date=May 2014|reason=What is a co-city? Define in body.}} The city nearest to Napasar is [[Bikaner]], which is only a few 30 kilometers away. It is connected to the NWR Bikaner railway station and NH 11, which is 12 kilometres outside of the town. Napasar is older than Bikaner.
The native language is [[Marwari language|Marwari]].{{citation needed|date=May 2014}}
Napasar is one of the largest [[Gram Panchayat]] of India. Napasar is also well known for being the birthplace of freedom fighter, social worker and their ex sarpanch Late Bajrang Lal Asopa, also known as Netaji. He worked for welfare of the village and his so-called "Fakira Fauz". After he died, a statue of him was placed in the main market and in the Gram Panchayat.
Napasar has [[industry|industries]] in manufacturing [[shawls|woolen shawls]], cotton chaddars (robes), [[textile industry|textiles]], tiles, [[PVC]], timber, [[food processing industry|food processing]] [[bhujia]] and [[papadum|papad]], among other things. Their textile and cotton industries are growing fast{{Citation needed|date = December 2013}}. Many people in Napasar have jobs in [[agriculture]] or investment. Because of the large number of jobs in agriculture, the city is able to produce food for the local market.{{Citation needed|date = December 2013}} Main sites of attraction in the town include: * Baba ramdev ji mandir (joona mandir) deshnok road * Maa Bhadra Kali temple (Pareek Chowk) * Gayatri mata temple * Shree dwarkashdeesh avam Santsiromani shree pitaji maharaj temple (gandhi chowk Built from the contribution of pipa chatriya samaj napasar) * GANESH Temple (at Deshnok road) * JHAWAR GUEST HOUSE :- Built by Late Hanumandas Ji Jhawar and Managed by Satyanarayan Ji Jhawar . The First Ganesha Temple in Gangasagar (west Bengal) is also managed by the Jhawar Family * Ved Vidhyalaya (Sanskrit Pathshala - Well known for its education) * DURGA MATA Temple (known as Soniya ri Bagichi because of more influenced/maintained by Soni families) * Hanuman Dhora (A Hanuman Temple on dunes)
* Laxminath Ji Temple (its land was given by the forefathers of late Shri Chogmal Ji Jhawar) * Maheshwari Bhawan (Built from the contribution of Maheshwari families and now it is the best place of its kind in Bikaner district and in neighbor districts) * Karni Mata Temple * Sai Baba Temple (Napasar – Sinthal Road) * Gopal Ji Temple (in Mundhara Mohalla) * Shri Ram Chandra ji Temple (Built from the contribution of Karnani Families) * Hanuman Vatika the great mandir of napasar built by panjia mundhra pariwar * Dungarpuri Hunman Ji Tample * Hanuman Bangli (Famous for Janmastmi Mahotsav) * Hanuman Temple (Jat mohllah) * Tara Mata Temple also known as Kali Mata Temple (100 meters from Napasar Railway Station and maintained by Bang families) * Veer Tejaji Temple (Near chungi chowki) * Jasnath ji ki badi (Jat mohllah) * Hanuman ji ka mandir Patta bass, nehru chowk * A holy pond known as PANDRIYA TALAYI nearby Ancient Lord Shiva Temple * A holly pond known as PAKKORI TALAYI , behind ramdev ji mandir * Vishwakarma Ji Temple (Nehru Chowk) * SBI BANK SINTHAL ROAD * RMGB Bank main market * PNB BANK STATION ROAD * post office inside panchyat bhawan *
